default.description: Unknown Error: Please Contact Programming Research Ltd.

cli_option.name: -crossmoduleanalysisfile
cli_option.description:
Sets up the template to be used for the project-wide .arc and other output files.

Sets up both the prefix and the absolute path (or, alternatively, the path relative to the current directory) of the diagnostic and metric output files generated by RCMA. Such output might take the form of .arc, .cma and .via files.

cli_option.name: -echo
cli_option.description:
Specifies that text is echoed to the console.

This option can be used to show the configuration files that are being referenced.

cli_option.name: -forgetall
cli_option.description:
Resets previous configuration settings for option.

Some options are cumulative in their action in that successive usage of the option adds extra settings rather than replacing the previous ones.

For example:

... -q path1 -q path2 -forgetall q -q path3 filename

For this argument list, the path1 and path2 options will be discarded and only path3 will be quieted.

cli_option.name: -intrinsictype
cli_option.default_setting:
-intrinsictype size_t="unsigned int"
QAC++ :
ptrdiff_t="int"
enum="int, unsigned int, long, unsigned long, long long, unsigned long long"
QAC:
ptrdiff_t="long"
wchar_t="unsigned char"
enum="int"
cli_option.description:
Determines the underlying type and semantics of types during parsing and analysis.

Determines the type associated with the sizeof operator (size_t), the result of pointer subtraction (ptrdiff_t), the behaviour of wchar_t, and the underlying type to use for enumerations. For more information on the use of the intrinsictype option, see the component manual.

cli_option.name: -list
cli_option.description: Used to specify a file list containing the source files and their output paths that are to be included in the analysis.

cli_option.name: -newarraycookiesize
cli_option.description:
Set the size of the new array cookie. The default value of -1 will result in cookie size being set to 'size_t'

The size in bytes of the overhead required by array new expressions can be set with this option. Different compilers may need different sizes and should be found in the compiler implementation documentation. The overhead size (commonly referred to as cookie size) defaults to size_t.

This option is applicable to Dataflow analysis of C++ only.

cli_option.name: -nomsg
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the display and generation of the specified messages.

Message numbers can be specified individually, or as a list, range or a combination of both:

  • -nomsg 2356
  • -nomsg 1234,1236,1240
  • -nomsg 2111,2200-2300


This option is only available at the file or directory level. The enabling or disabling of diagnostics at the component level is managed through the Rule Configuration File (RCF).

cli_option.name: -only
cli_option.description:
Only the specified warning messages will be generated.

Message numbers can be specified individually, or as a list, range or a combination of both:

  • -only 2356
  • -only 1234,1236,1240
  • -only 2111,2200-2300


This option is only available at the file or directory level. The enabling or disabling of diagnostics at the component level is managed through the Rule Configuration File (RCF).

cli_option.name: -outputpath
cli_option.description: Determines the path to which all output files will be generated during analysis, and, by extension, the location from which all files will be read as the input for RCMA analysis.

cli_option.name: -prodoption
cli_option.description:
Enables fine-grained configuration of analysis.

prodoption is used to provide additional fine-grained configuration to the analysis performed by a component.

Dataflow Analysis

-prodoption df::function_timeout=value

Purpose: Set an aggregate function timeout in milliseconds to limit the overall time spent in dataflow analysis for each function.

Default:no entry

This may curtail related results, and is designed to avoid lengthy analysis attempts on severely complex functions.

This option only applies when dataflow is enabled (-enabledataflow+).

-prodoption df::inter={0|1|2|3|4|5}

Purpose: Sets the maximum amount that a function will be allowed to grow by as a result of inserting called function code into the caller as part of inter-function analysis.

Default:-prodoption df::inter=0

The values applied have the following effect:

  • Setting '-po df::inter=0' means that no function growth is allowed.
  • Setting '-po df::inter=1' results in a maximum growth of 20.
  • Setting '-po df::inter=2' results in a maximum growth of 200.
  • Setting '-po df::inter=3' results in a maximum growth of 2,000.
  • Setting '-po df::inter=4' results in a maximum growth of 20,000.
  • Setting '-po df::inter=5' results in a maximum growth of 200,000.

A simplified statement refers to an internal deconstruction of source-level statements which includes expansion of temporaries, deconstruction of compound statements according to sequence points, and other requirements of dataflow examination. Therefore the number of explicit statements in a function will nearly always be less than the number of simple statements.

With df::inter=5, if the expanded set of simplified statements exceeds the limit of 200,000 message 2756 is generated.

This option only applies when dataflow is enabled (-enabledataflow+).

-prodoption df::cma[{+|-}]

Purpose: Determines whether inter-function analysis happens within a single module (translation unit), or across modules.

Default:-prodoption df::cma-

This option only applies when inter-function analysis is enabled (-po df::inter=X, where X>0).

-prodoption df::mta[{+|-}]

Purpose: Enables the generation of thread summaries.

Default:-prodoption df::mta-

When enabled, thread summaries for function bodies are written to the QAX daemon. This information is used by Multi-Threading Analysis (MTA) to perform its analysis.

For more information on this analysis, see the MTA component manual.

-prodoption df::query_timeout=value

Purpose: Sets the maximum time in milliseconds an individual query is allowed to execute.

Default:-prodoption df::query_timeout=50

Queries are an internal part of the dataflow analysis system, and several queries are typically run for each type of dataflow analysis performed. There can be many hundreds of queries performed for more complex functions.

Limiting the time spent on queries will cut short longer ones and may affect accuracy of results.

This option only applies when dataflow is enabled (-enabledataflow+).

Note: Some queries are cached in Dataflow to improve performance. Queries that timeout are also cached along with the current query timeout value. As such, when the Dataflow query timeout value is increased, these cached timed out queries will be re-run, to see if the increased time allows the solver to get an answer.

-prodoption df::query_timeout_message[{+|-}]

Purpose: Enables generation of message 2758 when any individual query times out.

Default:-prodoption df::query_timeout_message-

With this option enabled, message 2758 is generated if the dataflow analysis engine takes longer than the time configured with the -po df::query_timeout option on any individual query.

This option only applies when dataflow is enabled (-enabledataflow+).

-prodoption df::branch_model_threshold=value

Purpose: Sets the maximum branch cardinality for exact modelling of variable interdependency.

Default:-prodoption df::branch_model_threshold=200

Branch refers to:

  • if statement
  • && or || expression in an if statement
  • case clause of a switch statement

When control flow merges nested branches, it is possible more than one branch will be merged simultaneously, e.g. 


                
if (a)   // branch 1
{
  if (b) // branch 2
  {
  }
  // no statements following the 1st branch
}
// merge point for both branches

Due to tracking of variable interdependency, branch points that merge multiple branches are expensive for an SMT solver to evaluate. Branch points with cardinality exceeding the value configured are modelled such that variable interdependency is not tracked for the branches being merged. Therefore, at the expense of analysis accuracy, performance of dataflow may be improved by setting a value lower than the default. Setting a value higher than the default should be done with caution as it may cause excessive run time, message 2757 or a crash.

This option only applies when dataflow is enabled (-enabledataflow+).

-prodoption df::fncall_result_checked=functionName,firstValue,secondValue

Purpose: Specifies a function name and a pair of values that the function result must be checked against.

Default:no entry

This option configures the function names and the related value pairs the result must be checked against. It is used in combination with message 3535. This message checks whether the result of the specified function call has been checked against the pair of values. If the result from the function has been compared to the first value, the result should be compared to the second value as well.

For Example:

Using 

-po df::fncall_result_checked=foo,A,B


enum STATUS_t { A, B, C };

enum STATUS_t foo();

void bar()
{
  enum STATUS_t sts = foo();  /* expect: 3535 */

  if (sts == A)
  {
    // Do processing
  }

  sts = foo();                /* expect: !3535 */

  if (sts == A || sts == B)
  {
    // Do processing
  }

  sts = foo();                /* expect: !3535 */

  if (sts == C)
  {
    // Do processing
  }
}


If a number is specified in parentheses immediately after the function name, it is interpreted as the index (starting from 1) of an out-parameter which stores the result, rather than the return value itself.
For C++, member functions should be prefixed with the associated namespace and class, ie. 

::MyClass::foo
.
The value pairs can be macros, enums or scalars.

-prodoption df::execution_boundary=filename|path

Purpose: Specifies a file or path to be an execution boundary.

Default:no entry

When set, any include files which match the file or path specified used in the translation unit, will be considered to have a different ABI and its functions will denote an execution boundary. This option impacts QAC++ messages 3809-3811 and the C++ specific Dataflow messages 4741-4743; it has no effect on C code.


This option, which is solely for C++ analysis, applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.

-prodoption df::trust_boundary=filename|path

Purpose: Specifies a file or path to be a trust boundary.

Default:no entry

When set, any include files which match the file or path specified used in the translation unit, will be considered untrusted and its functions will denote a trust boundary. An example of a trust boundary is a kernel boundary, where data is passed between user and kernel space.


This option applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.

-prodoption dataflow::log_function_query_time[{+|-}]

Purpose: Prints a summary of solver query time spent per function during dataflow analysis.

Default:-prodoption dataflow::log_function_query_time-

This option adds a log entry at end of analysis which details the solver query time spent per function per translation unit.

-prodoption dataflow::log_function_memory_usage[{+|-}]

Purpose: Prints a summary of peak memory usage used per function during dataflow analysis.

Default:-prodoption dataflow::log_function_memory_usage-

This option adds a log entry at end of analysis which details the peak memory usage spent per function per translation unit.

-prodoption dataflow::stream[{+|-}]

Purpose: Enables streaming in dataflow.

Default:no entry

By default and when Inter TU Analysis is not enabled, dataflow runs in streaming mode: a translation unit processed by a parser is picked up by dataflow as soon as possible after completion. This helps taking advantage of threads available on the machine which are not used by parsers and can reduce overall analysis time. This option can be used to lower overall memory usage by disabling streaming. When setting it to false, dataflow starts processing the translation units in the project after all of them have been processed by the parsers.

This option is usually set by Framework based on the Inter TU Analysis option. See also program option df::virtual_memory_threshold for additional control on memory usage.

-prodoption dataflow::threads=value

Purpose: Sets the maximum number of threads to use to perform parallel analysis.

Default:no entry

This option can be used to reduce the number of threads, thereby reducing the amount of memory needed by dataflow when running on a machine with limited resources.

This option is usually set by Framework based on the config cpu option.

-prodoption df::cache[{+|-}]

Purpose: Enables the Dataflow caching functionality.

Default:no entry

This option enables the Dataflow cache. The df::cache_file parameter is also required, otherwise the functionality will not be enabled.

-prodoption df::cache_file=filename

Purpose: Specifies the Dataflow cache file for the Dataflow caching functionality.

Default:no entry

This option specifies the file to use for the Dataflow cache. If the file does exist, the cache contents will be read into memory by dataflow. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created and populated when dataflow exits. An additional lock file will be created to handle parallel reads and writes to the cache file.

-prodoption df::cache_save_period=value

Purpose: Enables the periodic saving of the Dataflow cache file. The period is specified in seconds.

Default:no entry

This option enables the periodic saving of the Dataflow cache file. Usually, if Dataflow terminates abnormally, the in-memory Dataflow cache will not have been written to file. Thus, any new query solutions will be lost. Enabling this option allows periodic saving of the cache file, so the solutions are available for subsequent Dataflow runs.

-prodoption df::virtual_memory_threshold=value

Purpose: Enables Dataflow load balancing by setting a virtual memory threshold.

Default:no entry

This option controls Dataflow behaviour when the process commit size (physical + page file) exceeds the specified threshold expressed as a percentage of physical memory (float or integer). Value 0 disables the threshold. It is recommended to combine this option with -po dataflow::stream=false to make dataflow run after all primary analysis is completed, thus giving dataflow better control of the OS commit charge.

cli_option.name: -quiet
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the generation of diagnostic and metrics output for the specified file or files in the specified path.

This will have the effect of suppressing warning messages as well as significantly reducing the size of the output produced.


This option applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.


This option should not be used for project header files or directories, as it may affect the results of CMA, Project Metrics and Reports.

cli_option.name: -quietextended
cli_option.description:
Suppresses the generation of diagnostic output for unused contents of the specified file or files in the specified path.

This will have the effect of suppressing warning messages as well as significantly reducing the size of the output produced. This suppression is limited to constructs from those files/folders that are not used in non suppressed files.

When the argument is a non-absolute path, the path is interpreted to be a regular file path relative to a -systeminclude path. If the concatenation of a system include path and the relative file path corresponds to an existing file, the option takes effect on that file.


This option applies only to included files and has no effect on the main source file.

cli_option.name: -remark
cli_option.description: The -remark option can be used to add additional comments into configuration files. Alternatively, comments can be included in the configuration files by prefixing the comments with an asterisk.

cli_option.name: -settings
cli_option.description:
Print the settings used by the tool after the complete processing of all command line arguments.

When enabled, the current values for all configuration options are listed to the standard output.

cli_option.name: -url
cli_option.description:
The URL of the server to which analysis data should be sent.

If no -url is specified, then output will be sent to the legacy output formats.

cli_option.name: -version
cli_option.description: When enabled, the version number is printed to standard out and the tool will exit immediately.

cli_option.name: -via
cli_option.description: Used to specify a file containing additional configuration options.

cli_option.name: -virtualmemorylimit
cli_option.description:
Determines the limit on the available memory a component can utilise.

Before analysis is performed by a component a limit is set on the amount of memory that the component can utilise. By default this limit is set to either a percentage of the systems physical memory or a default fixed size, whichever is largest.

This option determines the limit placed on the memory available to the component during analysis as a percentage of the total systems memory.

If the argument of this option is 0 then no memory limit is applied to the component. And if the value of the argument does not lie between 0 and 100 then the default limit will be applied.

The value of this 'while' or 'for' loop controlling expression is always 'false'. The loop will not be entered.
The result of this logical operation is always 'true'.
The result of this logical operation is always 'false'.
The first operand of this conditional operator is always 'true'.
The first operand of this conditional operator is always 'false'.
